str2: Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
Magdalene, a woman of Magdala. Feminine of a derivative of Magdala; a female Magdalene, i.e. Inhabitant of Magdala.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
From apo and enanti; from in front, i.e. Opposite, before or against.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A burial-place, sepulcher, tomb, grave. Masculine from thapto; a grave.
